message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.SY, cs.MM

Reasoning: 
1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper focuses on content-centric mobile HetNets and proposes a content delivery multihop routing protocol. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Networking and Internet Architecture sub-category.
2. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper discusses the optimal cache allocation strategy and characterizes the fundamental throughput-delay trade-off in terms of scaling laws. This suggests that the paper may also belong to the Information Theory sub-category.
3. cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) - The paper proposes a caching strategy that involves finding replication sets at mobile nodes and base stations via nontrivial variable decoupling. This suggests that the paper may also belong to the Data Structures and Algorithms sub-category.
4. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper discusses the optimal cache allocation strategy and characterizes the fundamental throughput-delay trade-off. This suggests that the paper may also belong to the Systems and Control sub-category.
5. cs.MM (Multimedia) - The paper discusses content delivery in mobile HetNets, which involves multimedia content. This suggests that the paper may also belong to the Multimedia sub-category.
